cufy.concurrent

Class Loop<I,P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • cufy.concurrent.Loop<I,P>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the functional interface for the looping code
    P - the parameter type for invoking next(Object)
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    For, Foreach, Forever, Once, While

    public abstract class Loop<I,P>
extends java.lang.Object
    Controllable loop. The concept is to do a block. Check if shall continue or not, do the posts. Then do the next block and so on.
    Since:
    18 May 2019
    Version:
    0.1.3
    Author:
    lsafer

      • thread

        protected final java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.Thread> thread
        The first caller of this loop.

        Note: having more than one caller is unpredictable and ILLEGAL!.

      • getThread

        public Loop<I,P> getThread(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Thread> action)
        Do the given action to the thread of this. with a locked access.

        Note: this may not be useful if this loop rapidly starts and finishes

        Parameters:
        action - to be done to the thread of this
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given action is null
        See Also:
        getThread()

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Get if this loop is alive or not.

        Note: this may not be useful if this loop rapidly starts and finishes

        Returns:
        whether this loop is alive or not.

      • isCurrentThread

        public boolean isCurrentThread()
        Check if the caller thread is the current thread of this loop.

        Note: this may not be useful if this loop rapidly starts and finishes

        Returns:
        whether the caller thread is the thread of this

      • join

        public Loop<I,P> join()
        Waits for this loop to die.

        Note: this may not be useful if this loop rapidly starts and finishes

        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalThreadException - if the caller thread is the current thread of this loop

      • join

        public Loop<I,P> join(java.util.function.Consumer<Loop<I,P>> alter,
                      long millis)
        Waits at most millis milliseconds for this loop to die.

        Note: this may not be useful if this loop rapidly starts and finishes

        Parameters:
        alter - what to do when the timeout is done
        millis - the time to wait in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value of millis is negative
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given alter is null
        IllegalThreadException - if the caller thread is the current thread of this loop

      • notify

        public Loop<I,P> notify(java.lang.String state)
        Update the state of this loop.
        Parameters:
        state - the new state name
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given state is null

      • pair

        public Loop<I,P> pair()
        Wait until make sure that this loop is running. By adding a new post and wait until get executed. Useful when starting a new loop on a new thread. To make sure that this loop started running.
        Returns:
        this

      • post

        public Loop<I,P> post(java.util.function.Function<Loop<I,P>,java.lang.Boolean> action)
        Make this loop (specifically the current thread looping) do the action given. Then remove that action if the action returns false.
        Parameters:
        action - to be done by this loop (return false to remove the action)
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given action is null

      • post

        public Loop<I,P> post(java.util.function.Function<Loop<I,P>,java.lang.Boolean> action,
                      java.util.function.Consumer<Loop<I,P>> alter)
        Make this loop (specifically the current thread looping) do the function given. Then remove that action if the action returns false. Or if this loop don't have a running thread.

        Note: no matter what. One (AND JUST ONE) of the given actions will be invoked.

        Note: action SHOULDN'T be synchronously invoked on ANY non-local object

        Parameters:
        action - to be done by this loop (return false to remove the action)
        alter - the action to be done if this loop don't have a running thread
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ether the given 'action' or the given 'alter' is null

      • post

        public Loop<I,P> post(java.util.function.Function<Loop<I,P>,java.lang.Boolean> action,
                      java.util.function.Consumer<Loop<I,P>> alter,
                      long timeout)
        Make this loop (specifically the current thread looping) do the function given. Then remove that action if the action returns false. Or the given timeout ended.

        Note: no matter what. One (AND JUST ONE) of the given actions should be invoked.

        Parameters:
        action - to be done by this loop (return false to remove the action)
        alter - to do when timeout and the action has not been done
        timeout - the timeout (in milli seconds)
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ether the given 'action' or 'alter' is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if ether the given 'timeout' is negative

      • start

        public Loop<I,P> start()
        Start this loop with the thread invoked the method. If this loop already running. Then the caller thread will wait until the previous thread ends the loop.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this loop still alive

      • start

        public Loop<I,P> start(java.lang.String state)
        Start this loop with the thread invoked the method. If this loop already running. Then the caller thread will wait until the previous thread ends the loop.
        Parameters:
        state - the initial state
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this loop still alive
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given state is null

      • synchronously

        public Loop<I,P> synchronously(java.util.function.Consumer<Loop<I,P>> action)
        Make this loop (specifically the current thread looping) do the function given. And WAIT for the loop to do it; If the CALLER thread get interrupted while it's waiting on this method. Then the action will be canceled.
        Parameters:
        action - to be done by this loop
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given 'action' is null
        IllegalThreadException - if the caller thread is the current thread of this loop

      • synchronously

        public Loop<I,P> synchronously(java.util.function.Consumer<Loop<I,P>> action,
                               java.util.function.Consumer<Loop<I,P>> alter)
        Make this loop (specifically the current thread looping) do the function given. And WAIT for the loop to do it. Or if this loop don't have a running thread (currently).

        Note: this may not be useful if this loop rapidly starts and finishes

        Note: no matter what. One (AND JUST ONE) of the given actions will be invoked once (also, JUST ONCE).

        Note: action SHOULDN'T be synchronously invoked on ANY non-local object

        Parameters:
        action - to be done by this loop
        alter - the action to be done if this loop don't have a running thread or if the action is canceled
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ether the given 'action' or the given 'alter' is null
        IllegalThreadException - if the caller thread is the current thread of this loop

      • synchronously

        public Loop<I,P> synchronously(java.util.function.Consumer<Loop<I,P>> action,
                               java.util.function.Consumer<Loop<I,P>> alter,
                               long timeout)
        Make this loop (specifically the current thread looping) do the function given. And WAIT until the loop invokes it. Or the given timeout ended.

        Note: no matter what. One (AND JUST ONE) of the given actions should be invoked.

        Parameters:
        action - to do with the looping thread
        alter - to do when the time is out before the action done
        timeout - to wait for the action to be invoked (milli seconds)
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ether the given 'action' or 'alter' is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given 'timeout' is negative
        IllegalThreadException - if the caller thread is the current thread of this loop

      • thread

        public Loop<I,P> thread()
        Start this loop on a new Thread.
        Returns:
        this

      • thread

        public Loop<I,P> thread(java.lang.String state)
        Start this loop on a new Thread.
        Parameters:
        state - initial state
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given state is null

      • next

        protected boolean next(P params)
        Invoke all codes of this loop (ONCE each). While calling tick() before and after each code.
        Parameters:
        params - to pass it to the next code
        Returns:
        whether allowed to continue the loop or not

      • tick

        protected boolean tick()
        Do things that should be done by this loop (except the loop code). This method is the base for any code invocation other than the looping code.
        Returns:
        whether the loop shall continue or break

      • assertNotRecursiveThreadCall

        private void assertNotRecursiveThreadCall()
        Make sure that the caller thread isn't the thread of this loop.

      • loop

        protected abstract void loop()
        The looping cod. call next(Object) inside the loop to invoke the code of this loop. Break the loop if it returned false.
